author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1705774827}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review:
[h1][b]Energy Balance[/b][/h1]

Energy balance é um puzzle de logica matemática ou seja tudo sem resume a primeiramente a criatividade, segundo a dificuldade e terceiro o visual.
O jogo não tem nenhuma criatividade, é o mesmo puzzle que muitos outros jogos aqui na steam oferecem, basicamente temos que formar as equações para chegar no resultado pré-definido.
Na dificuldade o jogo também é péssimo, em um jogo de lógica você normalmente tem que pensar um pouco até chegar em um raciocínio lógico, mas aqui não tem nenhuma lógica ou eu não consegui achar, é mais fácil resolver os puzzles na sorte ou até mesmo reiniciar o puzzle até encontrar um mais fácil do que tentar resolver os puzzles.
E o visual do jogo é péssimo além de ter uma história completamente desnecessária que aparece toda vez que você inicia um puzzle.
Um dos piores jogos que já joguei, não vale nem de graça.

review:
Pros:
+ Gameplay/puzzle concept.
+ Has native Mac and Linux/SteamOS version.

Cons:
- Poor story, which is unskipable. If quit level, then play it again you'll be served same story again.
- Below average UI/UX. Rather than only swapping between 2 number tile, it'd be better if we just drag the number tile around (whether to grid or outside grid). And there should be better font for the number tile.
- Developer describe this game as "easy to learn, but very hard to master", but i would describe it as "easy to learn, tricky to brute force" since you need to find combination of position which match all expected number.
- Visual/audio could be better for $3 game.

The concept is fairly good, but i doubt people would enjoy this game unless they're math geek or looking for all kinds of puzzle game.

review:
Energy Balance, bir bulmaca oyunudur. Oyunun hikayesi bir uzay gemisiyle ilgilidir. Uzay gemisi, bir görev esnasında anormal bir durumla karşılaşır ve tüm sistemleri kapandığı için gemi çalışmaz hale gelir. Oyuncu, gemiyi tekrar çalıştırmak için enerjiyi dengelemelidir.

Oyunda, güç hücrelerinin yerleri değiştirilerek toplam değerlerin yatay ve dikey olarak eşitlenmesi gerekmektedir. Oyunun temel amacı, oyuncunun becerilerini test etmektir. Energy Balance, öğrenmesi kolay ama ustalaşması zor bir oyundur. Oyunun grafikleri ve atmosferi, oyuncuları kendine çekecek kadar etkileyici ve dikkat çekicidir.

Oyunda ulaşılması gereken hedef, tüm güç hücrelerinin bağlantısını sağlayarak, enerji dengesini sağlamaktır. Bu sayede uzay gemisi tamir edilerek, görev tamamlanmış olur. Oyun, özellikle matematik ve mantık becerilerini geliştirmek isteyenler için iyi bir seçenektir. Energy Balance, oyunun öğrenme eğrisi yüksek olduğu için uzun bir oynanabilirlik sunar ve oyuncuların tekrar tekrar oynamasına neden olabilir.

review:
Очень приятная, небольшая логическая игрушка от русских разработчиков. Интересная задумка с расставлением цифр в блоки, цепочки. Есть над чем подумать, но и очень сложной игру не назвать. В игре 20 уровней, присутствует сюжет, но в подобных играх это не требуется, видимо задумка была в небольших паузах между уровнями, для отдыха мозга:) Не отнесу к плюсам музыку, тут она релаксирующая, но с вкраплением долбёжки по мозгам, отключается с главного экрана, так что проблем нет, включаем свою. Наверное, не самой удачной является и идея со шрифтом, цифры составлены из точек, иногда это вызывает дополнительные трудности, выглядит не очень разборчиво. Но в целом, удовольствие от решения паззлов здесь вы наверняка получите, плюс у игры очень небольшая стоимость, полностью себя оправдывающая.
p.s. Никакого труда не составит получение всех достижений в игре, просто закончите все уровни.

author: {'steamid': '76561198796851430', 'num_games_owned': 927, 'num_reviews': 3718, 'playtime_forever': 6315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1646390000}
review:
首先从核心玩法来看所强调的能量平衡机制并未在游戏中得到有效体现。游戏试图通过能量的获取、使用和平衡来构建游戏的挑战和策略性，但实际操作中，这一机制显得既复杂又混乱。玩家在游戏中很难明确掌握能量的最佳分配方式，往往因为能量的不足或过剩而陷入困境。这种不明确的能量平衡设计让游戏变得难以捉摸，缺乏应有的策略深度。

其次游戏的关卡设计也显得不尽如人意。关卡中的任务和挑战往往过于单调，缺乏足够的变化和惊喜。同时游戏缺乏明确的指引和提示，使得玩家在游戏中经常感到迷茫和无所适从。这种关卡设计的不足让游戏过程变得枯燥无味，难以激发玩家的兴趣和动力。

在画面和音效方面同样未能给玩家带来满意的体验。游戏的画面质量平平，缺乏足够的细节和精致度，使得游戏世界显得平淡无奇。音效方面，游戏的背景音乐和音效也显得单调乏味，无法为玩家营造出沉浸式的游戏体验。

此外游戏的操作体验也令人失望。控制角色移动和进行能量管理时，反应不够灵敏，操作不够流畅。这导致玩家在关键时刻无法做出及时的反应，影响了游戏的进程和体验。

最后从性价比的角度来看同样表现不佳。相较于其他同类游戏，它在玩法、画面、音效以及操作体验等方面都没有明显的优势，而价格却相对较高，这使得它的性价比相对较低。

综上所述，在能量平衡机制、关卡设计、画面音效以及操作体验等方面都存在令人失望的问题。如果你正在寻找一款能够让你在游戏中体验到能量平衡带来的策略性和乐趣的游戏，那么这款游戏可能不是你的最佳选择。希望开发者在未来的版本中，对游戏进行更深入的开发和优化，以提升玩家的游戏体验。

Steam does really offer better puzzle games.
If you look for them, some are a lot cheaper.
Therefore: It just feels subpar in comparison.

Energy Balance just didn't feel neat enough.
This game truly looks and sounds like trash.
Yeah, the actual gameplay is honestly okay.
I just can't recommend buying this, though.

review:
It's one of those games that I wish they had a neutral option for. While the robot cat looks cute and all, the dialogue is complete garbage. I kinda wish I could just play the various levels without the silly characters talking nonsense in between. 

Would I recommend it as a number puzzle? Sure, it's fun. If you want to test your brain a little, it's not a bad time waster in between doing other stuff. Some people complain that there is no logic to the puzzles. It's math and it's solvable, so of course there is.  It's not designed to be mega simplistic. You have to actually use your brain. But play it with the volume turned down. The music is beyond annoying.

If you're expecting a cute story, don't bother. It's shoite lol.

It's not worth full price, so definitely pick it up on sale. Pretty sure I got my copy from a rather cheap GMG bundle.

I'm giving it an upvote only because I've actually been enjoying the math puzzle element of the game.

review:

The first mode was quite easy to play. If I'm met with a hurdle in the game, I just randomly click on some tiles and voila, simple arithmetic problem solved! Then there goes the hardcore mode...

The last time I'd held a notepad and a pen for a game which involves trial and error calculation was when I played expert mode Sudoku. And that was ages ago. I got stuck on level 3 of the hardcore mode and I'd only gone back on this game after six months. It took me 4.2 hours to solve it. Now, I'm on level 4 of the hardcore mode and no longer have the energy to continue (I've just gotten through a cold and this game gave me more headache). I'll see this game back in six months.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027013569', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1536522913}
review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Un puzzle axé sur les maths. Enfin, les maths... les additions et les soustractions. Chaque tableau est rempli de nombres, et certaines lignes et/ou colonnes demandent que la somme des nombres de cette ligne/colonne soit égale au nombre indiqué. A cette fin, on intervertit les nombre entre eux, jusqu'à ce que les sommes correpondent.

Il y a une petite histoire bidon autour des puzzles à base de réparation de vaisseau spatial, c'est pas plus mal que d'être lâché directement sur les tableaux :). Les graphismes sont OK, la musique électro ambiante est plutôt sympa.

Le jeu est séparé en 3 parties. L'histoire, 12 niveaux, puis 4 niveaux hardcore, et enfin 4 niveaux bonus. Niveau difficulté, le mode histoire est correct, faisable sans trop de difficulté.

J'ai trouvé le mode hardcore pénible. Après avoir réussi le 1er niveau, j'ai vu que le deuxième proposait tellement de permutations possibles, sans rien pour vraiment procéder par élimination que j'ai laissé tomber. J'ai écrit un petit outil pour bruteforce la solution. Après avoir vérifié qu'il fonctionnait sur le niveau 1, j'ai tenté le niveau 2, réalisé que le bruteforce c'était pas optimal vu le temps requis, et trouvé que quelqu'un en avait fait déjà fait un ! Qui tourne bien mieux que le mien.  J'ai utilisé ça pour le mode hardcore, je préfère nettement les puzzles avec des solutions logique que des essais sans fins sur papier...

Le mode bonus propose des niveaux "carrés", de 3, 4, 5, puis 6 lignes/colonnes, dont chacune demande une somme précise. C'est pas compliqué du tout, il m'a fallut moins de 15mins pour faire les 4 niveaux. Je m'attendais à des trucs infaisables après le mode hardcore, mais pas du tout ! :).

[h1]Rejouabilité, achievements[/h1]

Les achievements s'obtiennent simplement en terminant tous les niveaux. La rejouabilité est bien présente, car les niveaux sont toujours aléatoires ! N'en fermez pas un en pensant revenir dessus plus tard, car il aura changé :).

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Un petit puzzle sans prétentions, plutôt agréable si on exclue le mode hardcore.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente, je n'ai pas rencontré le moindre soucis.

Screens : Dualscreen, 1x 4K & 1x 1920x1200, un seul screen X.

review:
Tak jak ktoś przede mną napisał: skrzyżowanie krzyżówki i sudoku. Niby nic trudnego, ale na wyższych poziomach zajmuje trochę czasu i umysłu. 

11 godzin wystarczyło na 100% osiągnięć. Przeniesienie gry w środowisko trójwymiarowe (kartkę, długopis, wiecej kartek i nożyczki) oszczędziło mi co najmniej kilka dodatkowych godzin. Jako że moje studia i praca w czasie kiedy grałam były całkowicie "humanistyczne" Energy Balance mi trochę zbilansowało mózg i zdecydowanie poświęcenie tej 1-2 godzin w ciągu dnia na nieskończone dodawanie i odejmowanie sprawiały mi przyjemność. 

Jeśli wizja gry podczas której tylko dodajesz, odejmujesz i przekładasz kafelki z miejsca na miejsce cię przeraża - do zdecydowanie nie gra dla ciebie. Ale jeśli nie masz nic przeciwko żeby odkurzyć trochę te szare komórki, których zwykle nie używasz - zdecydowanie polecam. 

Ja się bawiłam bardzo dobrze, nawet jeśli czasem pod koniec poziomu musiałam podliczać pod kreską 10+12 XD

Ps Losowość poziomów i to, że progres wewnątrz poziomu się nie zapisuje jest przekleństwem... albo błogosławieństwem. Czasem po prostu lepiej zresetować poziom niż męczyć się nad jakimiś dziwacznymi liczbami.

review:
혹시 당신이 스도쿠 같은 간단한 수학적 퍼즐을 즐기시나요? 아니면 일상생활에서도 수학적인 사고능력을 발휘하시는 편인가요? 그렇다면 이 [b]《에너지 밸런스》[/b]에 한 번 도전해보세요! 해당 게임은 변형 마방진으로 이루어진 퍼즐이 얼마나 즐거운 놀이인지 보여줄 것입니다. 오오, 물론 수학이라면 치를 떠는 분들께서는 스트레스 또한 가져다 줄 수 있는 게임이죠. 하하, 저는 어땠냐고요? 
[list]
[*] 머리를 굴려가며 최대 10분 제한 잡아 놓고 풀어본다

[*] 그 안에 안 되면 스크린샷을 찍고 '와, 이 퍼즐 어떻게 풀어요?' 라고 타 커뮤니티 사이트에 글을 올린다

[*] 레벨을 나갔다 들어오면 수가 재배열 되기 때문에 연락이 올 때 까지는 다른 게임을 하며 대기한다

[*] 친구에게 톡을 보내 [i]'야, 내가 살면서 해본 마방진 퍼즐 중에서 제일 어려운 듯. 니 이거 풀 수 있냐? 아니 ㅋㅋ 내기할래? 니 이거 푸나 못 푸나? 진짜 개 어려움'[/i] 이라면서 자존심을 건들여 푸는 것을 유도한다

[*] 사실 계속 끼워 맞추며 머리 쓰다 보면 풀리겠지만, 귀찮으니 연락을 기다린다

[*] 'ㅄ 풀었다 한 시간도 안 되서 만원 벌었네 개이득 내일 바로 내놔라' 라는 톡이 오고, 거기 적힌 숫자들을 넣어 본다

[*] 와, 이 새끼 역시 기계과는 뭔가 다르긴 다르네' 라는 경외심을 다시 한 번 느낀다
[/list]

공대 클라스는 뭐가 다르다는 걸 느꼈다. 프로그래밍 짜서 경우의 수 다 돌리면 되는 거 아니냐는 친구의 말에 순간 벙 찔 수밖에 없었다. 아니, 나는 문과충이라고 흑흑. 파이썬 조금만 배우면 짤 수 있는 게 문제가 아니란다. 게임을 하면서 스트레스를 많이 받았기 때문에 일단 엄지는 내리도록 하겠습니다.

review:
ONLY get this game if you can get it for free like I did, as it's essentially a mobile game and too simple for PC play. This is really by many standards a poorly made game, but the premise alone is SO original and fascinating that it's worth playing. It is loosely like the Japanese puzzle game Kakuro, but with negative values in the mix.

Here is how I would improve Energy Balance:
- The graphics feel disconnected. The number blocks look like they are made of primitive stone, versus the futuristic star background. I would change the block appearances.
- Make it CLEAR that the storyline dialogue can be skippable if you hit Space Bar (which makes a clickable "skip" button appear in the upper-right corner). I noticed this entirely by accident, and it takes way too long to display the text otherwise. Or just speed up the text and fade-in/-out character animations.
- Make it clear in the first level that any block can swap with any other block; you don't have to click only on adjacent blocks (which is a mistake I found myself doing at first until I tried otherwise).
- Add an optional sound effect per block click, and audio for the running text dialogue, like maybe a robotic mew sound for the cat. It's a bit odd to me that literally the only audio in the entire game is the music.
- Have the game remember your moves, to be able to undo moves. There is no "undo" button at all (although arguably this could be purposely omitted to make the game harder, which may float some players' boats).
- Have an option to [i]not[/i] reset the music to a different track every time you leave game-window focus.
- Some of the tracks I think are not very well balanced, audio-wise (some are louder than others). It would be good if the audio could be balanced.

Anyway, here's a hint about the gameplay itself: it comes off as EXTREMELY tricky at first but the more you play through it (especially once you start beating levels 3-4 or so), it becomes easier as you understand how the number-swapping process works. You balance as many energy cells as you can, and then once you get stuck with the remaining 1-3, you carefully substitute, following the paths of other cells to find appropriately fitting values. It's extremely elating once you can really start figuring out levels without too much difficulty.

While I have read from other reviews that there are only 20 levels, the energy values change every single time you play, so the game is technically infinitely replayable, which is really cool for such an otherwise short game.

I really look forward to seeing this game on Android! That's where it deserves to be, but not really here on Steam. It'd rock on any touchscreen device.

review:
[h1] Game Summary: [/h1] 
The developer of this game must have been on an energy streak, as there's no other reason to explain the inclusion of energy here.  It doesn't pertain to the concept or gameplay mechanics, and can only loosely be seen as relevant to the aesthetics.  The game itself is literally nothing more than basic algebra problems, the sort of set-up that you might have seen back in class for extra credit.  You would get a worksheet with a series of blank squares and numbers lined up, and had to put in the correct math symbol to make the equation work.  For example: 7 _ 3 _ 4 = 17 would translate into 7X3-4=17.  It's not an intolerable concept, but I can't help but feel as if it's born out of desperation, trying to turn something very simple and basic into a product to be sold.  At least back in class there was extra credit at stake, so what's in it for me in this case?  


[h1] Pros: [/h1] 
•	Some of the space backgrounds look pretty.  
•	It functions properly.


[h1] Cons: [/h1] 
•	The math isn't really that difficult, the problem is the UI.  You can only swap numbers with each other on the grid.  If you could pull them off the grid entirely and manipulate them freely, they'd be much easier to solve.  Instead you get distracted by noise and trying to balance multiple rows or columns at once, which is an inefficient way of solving an arithmetic problem like this.  
•	The storyline is rather absurd, written with the simplicity expected for children, without the packaging for it.  The broken down engines can only be fixed by solving some basic math problems.  Ready your pencil and paper captain, I'm going to need your help.  
•	In spite of how basic the game's premise is, there's only 20 stages to play.  
•	The music meanders and plays in a weird and annoying way.  
•	The space cat in the cutscenes looks freaky.  
•	Some cutscenes can't be skipped?


[h1] Conclusion: [/h1] 
There's really no reason to play this game.  The theme and storyline is threadbare, isn't engaging or interesting, and makes very little sense.  Many of the design choices in the game work against the player instead of being appealing, such as the distracting and irritating music.  Worst of all, the gameplay isn't fun.  In some situations a math puzzle can be fun to work out, but it needs to be set up and framed right.  The limitations of the game mechanics make the puzzles more difficult than they should be, and there's no pizzazz to make your math-solving abilities seem rewarded or fun.  You figured out the puzzle - now all the lanes are lit up and you can click on the green checkmark to load up the stage selection screen.  Then if you click on the next stage, you'll watch a static image of a robot and ugly cat talking for a short duration, with no voice acting included.  Isn't that exciting?  I don't recommend this lackluster experience to anyone, no matter how deeply in love with math they are.  A worksheet with the promise of a gold star sticker holds more incentive than this game grants.

review:
If you have played Sudoku, then this is right up your alley. 

Energy Balance is like the game title says,  A balance act. 

The game starts off with a robotic Neko/Cat stuck in Space.  Neko is left there trying to adjust spaceship components to progress to the next story event.

The gameplay is to come to mathematical equilibrium between connected rows and columns. Each end of the row and column has a number that you must equal from the direction it is facing. 

This will take some seriously number crunching and note taking in the later levels. Too many movable parts, can’t rely on luck. Each level is randomly generated, no use for walkthrough or a guide.

The Music is probably the best part. The tracks are varied and they don’t loop on a level. You never get irritated hearing the same track. It can distract you when you are trying to think. You can toggle it off, though.

2.99 is a fair price for what the game offers, but recommend getting on a sale or bundle.

review:
Tags: Casual - Number
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Audiovisually lackluster for a PC entertainment title. Sudoku with math operations thrown in. Gets old fast. 

Review: Sound design is alright, mostly spacey music, not a ton of tracks but recording quality is good. No sound effects to drive you mad so you can concentrate. Visuals are a little flat but the space background and slideshow story at least come together correctly thematically. Cutscenes lack cohesion in how it offers the skip button, if it even offers it. 

The puzzle design, meat of the game, is actually rather simple once you understand what you are doing, you basically match a row with the end goal result in the last bubble, then start adjusting other rows so they match as well, trading numbers between rows as necessary. It works, it is not the best implementation of a sudoku style game but it is slightly different if anything. Another reviewer compared it to a sudoku/crosswords hybrid and that is a very well put description

It is possible to get stuck trading numbers and making things worse rather than improving and some natural talent and ability of each player will play a great role in the ability to enjoy this one. The random generation of the numbers has been blamed for allowing brute forcing, but it also represents a potentially longer lifespan for the title.

Conclusion: It is servicable but nothing really stands out, the unique twist of it is as much an obstacle to enjoyability as it is refreshing at first, but as you repeat the same kind of mathematical conversions in your mind over and over, it just becomes a vaguely tedious chore. Not something really worth holding on to in permanent library. Best remove it for declutter.

review:
[quote]
Everything must be in balance. Unfortunately, this game, regardless of its name, doesn't know what it means...

[h1]It's about:[/h1]
[list]
[*]"add" and "sub" math operations with single- and two-digit numbers (pos. and neg.);
[*]getting a particular number in the end of the row (or interdependent rows).
[/list]

[h1]Why you should play this:[/h1]
[list]
[*]you like math and calculations;
[*]fair amount of levels (16 and + 4 more if you are lucky) with increasing difficulty;
[*]puzzles sometimes hard, but always manageable.
[/list]

[h1]Why you may not like it:[/h1]
[list]
[*]soundtrack - it doesn't fit at all, it's not exactly bad, it just distracts and irritates: complete miss with calm and meditative nature of the game;
[*]bug with 4 additional levels (at least for me) and it [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/375010/discussions/0/521643320367762563/]doesn't look like devs care[/url] about it.
[/list]

[I]Fair enough to say that devs forgot about balance: soundtrack doesn't fit, there's a chance that additional levels may not be available, gameplay can be considered as an actual gameplay only by ones who love math - pretty unbalanced outcome.[/i]
[/quote]

review:
Energy Balance ist ein Mathematisches-Rätzel Spiel was echt viel Hirn einsatz benötigt.

Geschichte:
Ist zwar für so ein Spiel nicht der MIttelpunkt kann aber einen Spieler reizen weiter zuspielen.

Die Geschichte ist relartiv Simpel aber für ein Mathe-Spiel okay. 
(dafür das ich noch keine anderen Mathe aufbauenden Spiele gespielt habe)

Gameplay:

Das Gameplay ist sehr Simple und man muss nur die Maus benutzen.

Allgemein:

Das Menu hat nur wenige Einstellungen und mir Fehlen da die Einstellungen für die Musik denn man kann nur die Musik an oder aus machen, was es schwer macht wenn man den
Sound nicht anders Leiser oder Lauter machen kann. Ich hätte mir gewünscht das es einen Musik-Pegel geben würde.
Deswegen empfehle ich Leuten mit Kopfhöreren oder Anlage den Sound je nach PC Einstellungen sofort runter zu drehen.

Was noch ein Dorn im Auge ist, ist das die Matherechnungen zufällig sind, was es für den Spieler um wesendlich schwerer macht. Ich hätte mir eine auswahl des Schwierichkeits Grad gewünscht. Ab einem bestimmten Grad würde es eigentlich schon unspielbar.

Fazit:

Für ein Mathe-Spiel hat es eine gute Story, das Gameplay ist Simple, aber dem Spiel fehlen noch einige Sachen die es besser machen könnten. Ein schlichtes Mathe-Spiel 4/10

review:
I hate maths!

Yet this game gets me to sit down, actually use my brain and surprisingly I enjoy it.

The basic concept is easy to understand, but that doesn't mean that the actual puzzles are anywhere close to easy. Especially in later levels you really need to think every move through or you'll get stuck pretty fast.

As everytime you close a level it will be reset to a new configuration you will not be able to copy the puzzle and think about it during your commute or the like, but this also means that once you do get stuck you can simply try again and maybe get something that's easier for you.

There's some story to this, though I must confess that after the first slow text scrawl I started skipping it altogether, so I can't comment on the quality of the plot.

Altogether I quite enjoy the game :)

review:
Pros: Easy to pick up and play, Simple mechanics, Easy badge (only 5 cards, you get 3 from drops) and the soundtrack is pretty cool. Good atmosphere, a smart robot and a cute space cat. :3

Cons: This is a logic/math puzzle game and there is no real logic to solving the puzzles. Restarting to generate another set of random numbers in hopes of getting a better set seems to be the way to win. When you finally get one that doesn't take 20 minutes to solve 1 part after completing all other parts you'll praise RNGesus. I'm serious, this game requires so much backtracking it's not even funny. RNG and blind guessing at it's finest. Don't bother buying it at full price, it's not even worth $1.99 let alone a dollar more. 

Conculsion: If you want to waste time, it would be better wasted on something else. If you want an easy badge, buy this with a coupon or if it goes on sale. I'm considering buying the soundtrack though...

review:
Całkiem fajna gra i mogę ją polecić osobom, które lubią gry tego rodzaju. Chodzi o rozwiązywanie łamigłówek w połączeniu z matematyką. Problem w tym, że takie Sudoku, w które zresztą bez problemu można zagrać za darmo, dla wielu pewnie będzie lepsze. Jeśli nie lubicie Sudoku, to tej gry raczej również nie polubicie. Jednak cena nie jest zbyt kosmiczna, a łamigłówki za każdy razem są ułożone z losowych liczb, co w efekcie powinno starczyć co najmniej na kilka godzin główkowania.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971948490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1442838417}
review:
While I really like number puzzles, they all have some sort of logical trick to them that you learn, and use to solve them.  You don't beat a Sudoku or a Kakuro with blind guessing, you have to eliminate the alternate possibilities until only one logical conclusion can be drawn...

This game doesn't do that.  At least, there's no logic underlying it that I've been able to find.  You really can't do anything but put together things that add up to possible answers, with no idea of whether you're screwing yourself over down the road. In short, it's blind guessing-and-checking until eventually you win, which defeats the purpose of a logic puzzle, since there's no real logic to it.  

Reading the other reviews, even the people who were giving this positive reviews said it was easier to just keep quitting and retrying the puzzles (the numbers are rerandomized each time you start a level) until you get numbers that tend towards extremes to make the possible permutations easier.  Thanks to that, the game largely revolves around "brute force tactics" of just rerolling until you get good numbers, then trying every permutation until one fits.  It makes the game feel frustrating; Rather than like some puzzle you feel clever for solving, it's just something you beat your head against until the puzzle broke first.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968671893', 'num_games_owned': 9219, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 845, 'last_played': 1442816317}
review:
Math simulator with a throwaway story about a robot alien and his robot cat trying to fix their ship.

Warning: if you don't like math and/or don't want to randomly throw tiles around a board until everything lights up, skip this.

The 'story' levels aren't too difficult, and seem to have multiple solutions, as I was able to finish them without too much effort. However if you want to complete the hardcore levels, be prepared to whip out some note-taking materials and do some number crunching (and DON'T CLOSE THE MAP). The one walkthrough for this game is basically "how to take notes and use a calculator".

On the upside, if you DO like to math, the numbers on the puzzles are randomized, and so each map is technically infinitely replayable. This can be frustrating if you have to leave and come back, as the numbers will be reset upon reopening the selected level.

Otherwise, basically sudoku crosswords.

Edit: I would like this a lot more if it had some more inbuilt tools for notes/number/combination tracking like Everyday Genius: SquareLogic (which I loved).

author: {'steamid': '76561197971341065', 'num_games_owned': 3377, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1441919458}
review:
This is a fairly simple math puzzle game where you have to get the sums in all rows and columns to match the required values by shifting around the numbers in the grid. There are twenty puzzles in all with the first six and last four being pretty easily, the 13-16th set can be difficult or not so bad depending on what the target values are (extreme positive and negatives tend to make it easier). The second row of puzzles can be pretty difficult and I often resorted to leaving it and coming back to get a new set of random numbers/puzzles to see if I got an easier set.

Generally the interface is limited but functional, but somewhat annoyingly it forgets if you turn the sound off the next time you play, the graphics are not great but they do the job, the storyline was forgettable, although a couple of times the cat's reaction did get a slight chuckle, and there isn't really any variety in the gameplay/puzzles. If you like these sorts of puzzles and given the low price tag it is probably just barely a recommendation.

review:
[h1]Energy Balance est un jeu de réflexion avec une histoire[/h1]

J’aime bien quand un jeu de réflexion est accompagné d’une histoire. Ce n’est pas obligatoire, mais c’est un plus pas désagréable.

Ici, vous jouez un spationaute dont le vaisseau traverse une anomalie spatiale. Cette anomalie dérègle tous les systèmes. Il faut les remettre en place et pour cela, il va falloir faire des maths, plein de mathématiques.

Le jeu s’inspire du sudoku (mais juste pour l’inspiration) et vous demande de faire plein d’additions et de soustractions. Des lignes de calcul sont imbriquées les unes dans les autres. Au niveau des résultats, il s’affiche le total actuel et le total que vous devez obtenir. Comme vous avez compris, toutes les lignes doivent afficher le total qu’il faut obtenir.

Il n’y a rien à critiquer sur ce jeu là, il est très bon. En plus :
- il est traduit en français
- il a un prix ultra-doux puisqu’il coûte un peu moins de deux euros

[url=www.graal.fr/2015/07/06/test-energy-balance-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour lire l'ensemble de mes impressions sur Energy Balance.[/url]

[h1]Here is my review about the game [b]ENERGY BALANCE[/b] [/h1]

Energy balance is basically a number puzzle indie game,the game is made of engine named Unity 3D by a bunch of young developers.
The game is fun but you need to be smart enough to play this game.

[b]About the game[/b]

During a mission your spaceship encounters an unknown anomaly and all system fail. You have to balance the energy in order to get them running again and to get home safely. 

Energy Balance is a number puzzle. You have to swap power units in such a way that their sums form correct chains both vertically and horizontally. The game is easy to learn, but very hard to master. So, are you ready to peep under the hood of an alien spaceship?

The game is pretty much worth and yes it does give you a ton's of fun.
The game consists of Trading Cards in which you would be able to craft badges and get amazing background images.

As for me i would recommand this game to all the "Puzzle" loving gamer's out there.

Thank you for reading.

review:
Cheap puzzle game.

Your task is to rearrange the numbers on a grid so that each line adds up to a target sum. You do this by switching numbers around on correct lines so that the crosslines start to add up; sometimes you can switch out numbers with extra spots that aren't used in any sum; and sometimes you need to carefully switch out equal pairs so that you can free up numbers you need elsewhere. The learning curve for this is ultra steep. Each level is randomly generated numbers on a pre-configured grid - if you leave a level, you'll get new random numbers the next time you play it.

Since the audio is a synthetic space background music track, the feedback is purely visual; and that is only in terms of animation, correct squares, lines or results don't change color, they just spawn some fireworks (in addition to some general blinking going on, so don't play this if you're sensitive). It works somewhat because the fireworks along the lines is fairly discernible.

Note that when playing this game, you first have to click through a bunch of dialogue that is you talking to your space cat (press space and a "skip" icon appears), which you will do as you enter each level, each time, before you get to the numbers grid. Your reward for finishing a level is the ability to access the next level and see more space cat dialogue.

The game is realized with Unity, and it scales up nicely to 1080p fullscreen, or you can play it windowed (albeit non-resizable).

The problems I see with this game are poor visual feedback, and no audio feedback; a steep learning curve because there are no handcrafted levels that would slowly add difficulty, leaving the player to flounder with trial and error; and I don't like the graphical style and background music much.

Recommended if you like doing simple sums for fun.

review:
Очень приятная, небольшая логическая игрушка от русских разработчиков. Интересная задумка с расставлением цифр в блоки, цепочки. Есть над чем подумать, но и очень сложной игру не назвать. В игре 20 уровней, присутствует сюжет, но в подобных играх это не требуется, видимо задумка была в небольших паузах между уровнями, для отдыха мозга:) Не отнесу к плюсам музыку, тут она релаксирующая, но с вкраплением долбёжки по мозгам, отключается с главного экрана, так что проблем нет, включаем свою. Наверное, не самой удачной является и идея со шрифтом,  цифры составлены из точек, иногда это вызывает дополнительные трудности, выглядит не очень разборчиво. Но в целом, удовольствие от решения паззлов здесь вы наверняка получите, плюс у игры очень небольшая стоимость, полностью себя оправдывающая.
p.s.  Никакого труда не составит получение всех достижений в игре, просто  закончите все уровни.
